summary: The concept of "local radio," as categorized under communications, is redirected to the preferred term "local media" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. Local media encompasses various forms of communication, including radio, that serve specific geographic communities, fostering cultural diversity and promoting local content. The EU recognizes the significance of local media in enhancing democratic participation and ensuring pluralism in information dissemination. Regulatory measures aim to support local media outlets, ensuring their viability against larger national and international entities. This relationship underscores the importance of local media in maintaining a vibrant public sphere and safeguarding the interests of local audiences.
